title: Govt: Indus Waters Treaty will be on hold till Pakistan totally stops terror export
content: India has suspended the Indus Waters Treaty. The Jal Shakti ministry informed the cabinet secretary. The treaty will remain inactive. This will continue until Pakistan stops supporting cross-border terrorism. Pakistan has requested India to reconsider the treaty. They cited the dependence of millions on the water regulated by it. The decision follows a terror attack in Pahalgam.

title: Is Trump administration planning to move 1 million Palestinians to Libya?
content: Reports surfaced that the Trump administration explored a plan to relocate up to 1 million Palestinians from Gaza to Libya, potentially using unfrozen Libyan funds as compensation. However, the State Department refuted these claims, deeming the situation in Libya unsuitable.

title: 'India is elated and proud': PM Modi lauds Neeraj on breaching 90m mark
content: Neeraj Chopra made history at the Doha Diamond League 2025, becoming the first Indian to breach the 90-meter mark with a 90.23m throw. Despite this personal best, he secured second place, with Germany's Julian Weber winning at 91.06m. PM Narendra Modi lauded Chopra's achievement as a moment of national pride, acknowledging his dedication.

title: 'Talent vacuum in BJP': Cong on Tharoor leading delegation to expose Pak's terrorism
content: The Congress party lauded the Centre's decision to appoint Shashi Tharoor to lead a delegation of MPs to expose Pakistan-sponsored terrorism on international platforms, citing a perceived "talent vacuum" within the BJP.

title: Nagpur woman on vacation crossed into Pakistan ‘to meet pastor she met online’
content: Sunita, a 43-year-old Nagpur woman, has crossed the Line of Control into Pakistan, baffling Indian security agencies. Driven by a desire to meet a Pakistani pastor she met online, this was her third attempt to cross the border. She left her son in Kargil before crossing over and is now believed to be in Pakistani custody.

title: Indian-origin man slammed for calling to send H-1B holders back
content: An Indian-origin man in the US, Rohit Joy, sparked controversy by suggesting the termination of the H-1B visa program and the return of its holders to their home countries. This proposal came in response to Congressman Dr. Rich McCormick's advocacy for domestic visa renewals.

title: Watch: In a first, Pakistan PM admits India hit Nur Khan Airbase
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif revealed that Indian ballistic missiles struck Nur Khan Airbase and other locations, prompting a late-night call from the Army Chief. India initiated Operation Sindoor following a terror attack, targeting terror infrastructure and militants. Hostilities ceased on May 10 after retaliatory actions and coordinated attacks on Pakistani airbases.

title: ‘To easy lol’: 10 inmates use blankets to escape through hole in New Orleans jail
content: In a brazen jailbreak, ten inmates escaped the Orleans Justice Center in New Orleans after exploiting a hole behind a toilet. The absence of a guard and suspected insider assistance facilitated the escape. Two fugitives have been apprehended, while eight remain at large, considered armed and dangerous. Authorities are investigating security failures and urging public vigilance as the search intensifies.

title: 'Teachers overburdened': 18 govt schools in Haryana record zero passes in 12th boards
content: Following the declaration of class 12 board exam results, eighteen government schools in Haryana have come under scrutiny due to a zero percent pass rate. These schools are among 100 poorly performing institutions that have overshadowed the state's overall pass percentage.

title: Boycott Turkey: Flipkart’s Myntra, Reliance-owned Ajio stop selling Turkish brands
content: Following Turkey's support for Pakistan during a recent military conflict, Myntra and Ajio have reportedly stopped selling Turkish apparel brands. According to Reliance, this decision aligns with national sentiment, prompting reassessments of partnerships and the closure of Reliance's Turkey office. Traders' body CAIT has also called for a complete boycott of trade with Turkey and Azerbaijan, urging policy reviews and discouraging business engagements.

title: Blow to Trump? Moody's strips US of top credit rating
content: Moody's Ratings has lowered the United States government's credit rating. This is due to concerns about increasing government debt. The downgrade creates problems for President Trump.

title: Supreme Court irked by repeated PILs to stop Rohingya deportation
content: The Supreme Court rebuked repeated PIL attempts to halt the alleged deportation of Rohingya Muslims, emphasizing that previous relief was denied on May 8. Senior Advocate Colin Gonsalves' plea, citing the deportation of 28 Rohingyas and threats to their lives in Myanmar, was met with skepticism due to lack of verifiable evidence.

title: 'Don't make Jasprit Bumrah captain': Ravi Shastri drops bombshell
content: Ravi Shastri suggests grooming Shubman Gill or Rishabh Pant as India's next Test captain, following Rohit Sharma's retirement. He advises against burdening Jasprit Bumrah with captaincy due to injury concerns. Shastri emphasizes the importance of age and longevity, highlighting Gill and Pant's leadership experience in the IPL. He dismisses concerns about Gill's overseas performance, backing his potential for future success.

title: Bill Gates on Mark Zuckerberg's plan to give away his wealth: There are people…
content: Bill Gates has praised Mark Zuckerberg's commitment to donate 90% of his wealth through the Chan-Zuckerberg Initiative, highlighting Zuckerberg as a key figure in the next generation of philanthropists. Gates himself plans to donate 99% of his wealth to the Gates Foundation within 20 years, emphasizing the growing trend of tech entrepreneurs engaging in significant charitable giving.

title: King Charles III is now richer than Queen Elizabeth II: But how did this happen?
content: King Charles III's personal wealth has surged to an estimated £640 million, surpassing that of his mother, Queen Elizabeth II, due to inherited investments and estates. This increase places him on par with Rishi Sunak and Akshata Murty, despite their wealth slightly decreasing.

title: 'I’m in no rush': Trump says India willing to cut 100% tariffs for US
content: President Trump claimed India offered to eliminate all tariffs for the U.S., but he's in no rush to finalize a trade deal. This follows India's aim to secure an agreement during a tariff suspension period. Bilateral trade between the two nations reached $129 billion in 2024, with India holding a $45.7 billion surplus.

title: '$40,000 vs $41 mn': Trump praises Iranian drones for being 'good, fast and deadly'
content: Donald Trump praised Iranian drone technology for its affordability and effectiveness, contrasting its low cost with the high prices quoted by US defense manufacturers. He highlighted the deadly impact of drones in modern warfare, referencing their use in conflicts like the Russia-Ukraine war.

title: 'I wanted to play ... ': Rohit Sharma's emotional confession
content: Rohit Sharma was overcome with emotion at Wankhede Stadium as a stand was unveiled in his name, a tribute to his illustrious career. He expressed gratitude to his parents for their sacrifices and shared the honor with legends Ajit Wadekar and Sharad Pawar. Ritika Sajdeh, Rohit's wife, stood beside him, smiling proudly as she soaked in the emotional moment.

title: Mumbai's Atal Setu: 28-year-old driving BMW dies after crashing into dumper
content: In a tragic incident early Friday, Punit Singh Majra, 28, died after crashing his rented BMW X1 into a dumper on the Atal Setu in Mumbai. Driving at a speed of 180 kmph, Majra lost control of the vehicle. Police extracted his body from the wreckage and transported him to a hospital, where he was declared dead.

title: UP nursery student dies after being slapped for crying
content: In Prayagraj, a three-and-a-half-year-old nursery student tragically died after allegedly being slapped by teachers at his private school. Police have registered an FIR against the teachers for culpable homicide, following allegations of physical and emotional distress inflicted upon the child.

title: Rohit Sharma pretends to punch fan at Wankhede Stadium - WATCH
content: An emotional Rohit Sharma, alongside his family, unveiled the 'Rohit Sharma Stand' at Wankhede Stadium, a tribute to his parents' sacrifices. He shared a light moment with a fan and expressed gratitude to his family during the Mumbai Cricket Association ceremony. Rohit’s wife, Ritika, stood proudly by his side, her beaming smile reflecting the pride of the occasion.

title: FDA greenlights blood test for Alzheimer’s disease: How does it work?
content: The FDA has cleared the Lumipulse G pTau217/β-Amyloid 1-42 Plasma Ratio test, the first blood test for early Alzheimer's detection in adults aged 55 and older showing symptoms. It analyzes pTau217 and beta-amyloid ratios, correlating with brain amyloid plaques. This advancement offers a more accessible and cost-effective alternative to PET scans, potentially enabling earlier intervention and treatment.

title: Op Sindoor: Over 600 Pakistan drones killed by Army air defence units
content: Indian Army's air defence units swiftly deployed along the western front, successfully neutralizing over 600 Pakistani drones and repelling the rest during 'Operation Sindoor'. A multi-layered air defence network, integrating legacy weapons with indigenous systems like Akash and Akashteer, showcased unmatched precision and thwarted Pakistan's attempts to overwhelm India's air defence grid. This operation demonstrated India's enhanced AD preparedness.

title: India gives special entry to 160 Afghan trucks via Attari
content: Following the first political contact between India and the Taliban, India approved the entry of 160 Afghan trucks carrying dry fruits and nuts through the Attari border as a special gesture. Despite not formally recognizing the Kabul regime, India remains Afghanistan's largest export market in South Asia, with trade valued at $1 billion.

title: Celebi moves Delhi HC against revocation of security clearance
content: Celebi Airport Services India challenges the revocation of its security clearance in Delhi High Court. The aviation watchdog BCAS took the action citing national security concerns. The firm argues the decision impacts thousands of jobs and investor confidence. Celebi denies any political affiliations and emphasizes its compliance with Indian regulations.

title: 'Yeh kya hai?': Rohit Sharma loses cool, scolds brother for denting his car
content: The Wankhede Stadium honored Rohit Sharma with the unveiling of the 'Rohit Sharma Stand.' An emotional Rohit expressed gratitude to his family and fans, reflecting on his journey since 2007. A lighthearted moment, capturing Rohit playfully teasing his brother about a car dent, went viral. He acknowledged the stadium's significance and looked forward to playing for Mumbai Indians there.

title: INDIA bloc ‘frayed’, says Chidambaram, calls for coordination
content: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram voices worries about the INDIA bloc's unity. He emphasizes the need for a strong alliance to challenge the BJP. Chidambaram describes the BJP as a formidable and well-organized force. He suggests the BJP controls various institutions. His remarks highlight the challenges facing the opposition in India.

title: Relief rally: Sensex soars 3,000 points in week
content: Dalal Street witnessed a significant rally following the Indo-Pak ceasefire, adding over $300 billion to investor wealth. The Sensex and Nifty climbed, fueled by foreign and domestic fund inflows, a fall in retail inflation, and expectations of RBI rate cuts. Smallcap and midcap stocks outperformed, with defense and railway sectors experiencing substantial gains.

title: Neeraj Chopra issues fiery warning after epic throw
content: Neeraj Chopra achieved a personal best of 90.23m at the Doha Diamond League, finally crossing the 90m threshold, but finished second to Germany's Julian Weber, who threw 91.06m. Despite the 'bitter-sweet' result, Chopra is optimistic, crediting his coach Jan Zelezny and feeling fitter after groin issues. Chopra credited the favourable conditions in Doha for helping him unleash the big throw and shared that Zelezny had predicted a 90m effort even before the competition.

title: CJI chides bar associations for boycotting Justice Trivedi's farewell
content: CJI B R Gavai expressed his disapproval of the Supreme Court Bar Association and the SC Advocates-on-Record Association's decision to boycott Justice Bela M Trivedi's farewell. The boycott was triggered by a divided Supreme Court bench ruling regarding the punishment of an AoR accused of suppressing information in a criminal case, where Justice Trivedi's order differed from her colleague's.

title: Neeraj Chopra finally breaches 90m barrier, finishes second in Doha DL
content: Neeraj Chopra made history at the Doha Diamond League 2025, crossing the 90-metre mark in javelin for the first time with a throw of 90.23m. Despite this personal best, he secured second place as Julian Weber of Germany won with 91.06m.

title: Hyundai lines up new models to regain ground
content: Hyundai plans a major India expansion. The company will launch 26 new cars in the next five years. This includes electric, hybrid, and petrol models. Hyundai will invest Rs 7,000 crore. The company aims for a bigger market share. They are focusing on profits, not discount wars. Eight new models are expected by FY27.

title: ‘Indirect terror funding’: Rajnath slams IMF on $1 billion loan to Pakistan
content: Rajnath Singh has asked IMF to rethink its $1 billion aid to Pakistan. He believes Pakistan will use the funds for terror activities. Singh highlighted India's strikes on terror hubs and warned Pakistan. He mentioned the rebuilding of LeT and JeM headquarters. Singh stated India is closely monitoring Pakistan's actions regarding cross-border terrorism.

title: Op Sindoor: BJP defends MP deputy CM as a row erupts over his remarks
content: Madhya Pradesh Deputy CM Jagdish Devda's remark praising PM Modi and the army during 'Op Sindoor' sparked controversy, with Congress alleging he implied soldiers are at Modi's feet. BJP defended Devda, accusing Congress of targeting him for being Dalit. Devda refuted the claims, asserting he meant the nation salutes the army's bravery.

title: Govt to send all-party teams to brief nations on Pak-sponsored terrorism
content: To bolster its diplomatic efforts regarding Operation Sindoor, the government is dispatching five all-party parliamentary delegations worldwide to highlight Pakistan-sponsored terrorism. These delegations, comprising members from various parties, aim to showcase national unity on the issue. While most parties are participating, Congress expressed concerns about the government's direct outreach to its MPs instead of consulting the party leadership first.

title: PM Modi to address rally close to Indo-Pak border in Rajasthan next week
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit Deshnok in Rajasthan's Bikaner district on May 22, marking his second visit to an IAF base after the May 7 strikes. He will offer prayers at the Karni Mata temple and address a rally. The visit, following Operation Sindoor, includes a possible meeting with soldiers deployed along the Indo-Pak border.

title: NHL legend Theo Fleury slams PM Mark Carney in blunt social media attack
content: NHL legend Theo Fleury sparked controversy with a blunt “Not my PM” comment aimed at newly appointed Prime Minister Mark Carney. The post quickly divided public opinion, some applaud Fleury for speaking his mind, while others feel he’s deepening the divide. As Carney calls for unity, Fleury’s bold words reflect the rising tensions and frustrations felt by many Canadians today.

title: Tasmac MD faces ED quizzing in Rs 1,000 crore graft case
content: Enforcement Directorate (ED) interrogated Tasmac MD S Visakan over suspected financial irregularities within the Tamil Nadu State Marketing Corporation. ED conducted searches at Visakan's residence and other locations, including the house of film producer Akash Baskaran. The investigation stems from a suspected ₹1,000 crore scam involving inflated bottle prices, based on DVAC FIRs.

title: SC grants Iskcon-Bengaluru control of city temple, overturns HC order
content: The Supreme Court resolved a 25-year legal dispute. Iskcon Bangalore gains control of the Hare Krishna temple. The court overturned a Karnataka High Court order. The dispute involved Iskcon Mumbai's claim. The court examined documents and witness statements. It favored Iskcon Bangalore's ownership. The ruling ends a long battle between the two factions.

title: No chaos at major airports as other ground handlers step in
content: A recent government rule impacted operations of Turkiye's Celebi at nine Indian airports. Existing ground handling agencies stepped in to manage the workload. GMR Group made alternate arrangements at Goa's Mopa airport. Over 10,000 Celebi employees were absorbed by other handlers like Bird Group and AISATS. Operations have stabilized with no major disruptions.

title: Precise intel big contributor in Sindoor’s success: Shah
content: Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated the upgraded Multi-Agency Centre (MAC), highlighting its role in coordinating efforts against national security threats. He credited 'Operation Sindoor' to strong political will, intelligence, and armed forces' capabilities. The upgraded MAC integrates AI and machine learning for advanced data analytics, aiming to combat terrorism and organized crime by connecting various databases and improving intelligence coordination.

title: Gujarat Samachar director held by ED, granted bail till May 31
content: Bahubali Shah, director of Gujarat Samachar Ltd, was granted interim bail until May 31 by a special PMLA court due to deteriorating health after his arrest by the Enforcement Directorate on money laundering charges. The arrest followed searches at multiple locations, and the ED did not object to temporary bail given Shah's condition.

title: Alarm ringing in Himalayas: Environment minister Bhupender Yadav
content: Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav addressed the ecological vulnerability of the Himalayas due to accelerated glacier melt, emphasizing the threat to water security. A study reveals the rapid retreat of Himachal Pradesh's Gepang Gath glacier and the dramatic expansion of its proglacial lake. The study calls for urgent measures, including early warning systems, to prevent potential disasters.

title: Jnanpith Award conferred on Gulzar, Rambhadracharya
content: President Droupadi Murmu presented the 58th Jnanpith Award to Sanskrit scholar Jagadguru Rambhadracharya and poet-lyricist Gulzar for their contributions to literature. Rambhadracharya, a renowned Hindu leader and writer, was present to receive the award, while Gulzar was absent due to health reasons. Additionally, Hindi author Vinod Kumar Shukla has been named the recipient of the 59th Jnanpith Award for 2024.

title: CRPF officer killed by lightning while conducting anti-Naxal op
content: In a tragic incident, a senior CRPF officer lost his life, and three others sustained injuries due to a lightning strike during an anti-Maoist operation in Jharkhand's Saranda forests. The deceased, M Prabo Singh, was leading the joint operation when the unfortunate event occurred. The injured personnel have been airlifted to Ranchi for medical treatment.

title: Patronage from government needed for keeping folk arts alive
content: Founder of Gidugu Ramamurthy Telugu Bhasha and Janapada Kalapeetham urges government to allow each major temple to adopt at least one folk art form so that artistes will be able to perform frequently and pass on their skills to the next generation

title: Folk art forms, once Andhra’s signature, fading into oblivion
content: Art forms such as Tholu Bommalata, Chekka Bhajana, Gangireddu Aata, Dasarulu, Samu Garadi, Karrasamu, Jamukula Pata and Yakshaganam are on the verge of extinction in the State, with little patronage from society and government

title: AP Liquor Scam: SIT arrests former Secretary to CM Dhanunjaya Reddy, OSD Krishna Mohan Reddy
content: Police grilled the duo for about ten hours and announced their arrest on Friday, and the accused would be likely to be produced in the ACB Special Court

title: Mumbai airport ropes in Indo Thai Airport Services for ground handling works
content: “All ground handling equipment currently owned by Celebi NAS will be leased by Indo Thai Airport Services, in order to maintain continuity of service,” the statement by Mumbai International Airport Limited said

title: Karnataka seeks electric buses under PM E-Drive; Union Minister Kumaraswamy assures support
content: Karnataka Transport Minister Ramalinga Reddy submitted the proposal to the Ministry of Heavy Industries, citing the growing need to strengthen public transport in major cities across the state.

title: Vijay Shah remark row: Congress protests outside Raj Bhavan demanding dismissal of M.P. Minister
content: The Congress questions BJP’s ‘inaction’ against its Minister Vijay Shah and also State Deputy CM Jagdish Devda for his ‘Forces bowing down to Modi’ remarks

title: Maharashtra IPS transfers-promotions: Arti Singh posted as Mumbai’s first intelligence Joint CP
content: The sixth post of joint commissioner in the metropolis’ force was created recently by the State Government to boost intelligence gathering

title: IWT to remain suspended until Pakistan abjures support for cross-border terror: Jal Shakti ministry
content: According to sources, Pakistan's Water Resources Secretary Syed Ali Murtaza had expressed his government's readiness to discuss specific objections raised by New Delhi

title: Restore farmers’ confidence by ensuring MSP for produce, A.P. Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu tells officials
content: Traders must commence procurement of tobacco at remunerative prices immediately, he says, adding that a special model be developed for cocoa cultivation and marketing; the Chief Minister directed officials to purchase remaining paddy from farmers and encourage them to cultivate fine (sanna) varieties

title: KTR’s hypocrisy on women’s dignity is laughable: Congress MP
content: Bhongir MP Chamala Kiran Reddy said the symbolic gesture of some volunteers helping the Miss World contestants wipe their feet was being blown out of proportion by the BRS

title: India will no longer tolerate terrorist attacks, says CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: Speaking at the Tiranga Yatra on the arterial M.G. Road here on Friday, Mr. Naidu said the manner in which India built its weaponry was commendable

title: Tiranga rally taken out in Tirupati to celebrate success of Operation Sindoor
content: Students, traders, ex-servicemen, industrialists, educationists, community leaders and leaders from BJP, TDP and Jana Sena Party take part in rally

title: U.P. govt to soon launch new health policy, eyes private investment
content: Under the new policy, 200-bed Super-Specialty Hospitals will be established in municipal corporations and 57 district headquarters

title: Sanjay Raut’s book refers to BJP bigwigs as ‘ingrates,’ triggering a political row
content: He claimed that Balasaheb Thackeray, and Sharad Pawar helped Mr. Modi and Mr. Shah when they faced political and legal troubles, yet the two were ungrateful

title: Opposition united only by hatred of PM Modi, says Kerala BJP chief Rajeev Chandrasekhar
content: ‘The fact that INDI alliance represents not even one idea for bettering lives, for bettering India, has been known for several years now’, says the BJP leader

title: Stopping conflict a ‘big success’, level of anger was not a good thing: Trump
content: Mr. Trump has been continuously claiming that the U.S. brokered the ‘ceasefire’ between New Delhi and Islamabad but the Indian govt. has maintained that the DGMOs of the two countries arrived at an understanding to stop the conflict

title: When home is near the border
content: After days of living through heightened uncertainty following the targeting of civilians by Pakistan, villagers along the India-Pakistan border in Punjab are hoping that peace holds and their lives return to normalcy, reports Ishita Mishra

title: Haryana’s Nuh adopts sports-driven approach to combat drug abuse
content: Large turnout at sports events provides opportunity for organisers and officials to address various health and social issues, including rising tuberculosis cases, high dropout rates, and drug addiction

title: Telangana is a medical tourism hub drawing over one lakh visitors annually: Health Secretary
content: The State’s appeal is now expanding further to Southeast Asia and Europe, said Telangana Health Secretary Christina Z. Chongthu

title: Aurobindo Pharma arm launches leadership programme at IMTH
content: A six-month programme, the CLP aims to transform promising professionals into dynamic leaders by equipping them with skills in managing self, teams, business and change

title: Miss World contestants experience Telangana’s blend of eco-tourism and heritage
content: The day’s itinerary included visits to the Pillalamarri banyan tree in Mahabubnagar to eco-tourism haven of Experium Eco Park near Hyderabad

title: Kollam police books Kesari editor N.R. Madhu on charges of creating enmity between communities
content: Mr. Madhu had allegedly portrayed rapper Vedan, who hails from the Dalit community, as a “disreputable character” who makes a mockery of art and injects caste venom in society

title: India to do whatever is necessary to build ties with Afghanistan: officials
content: New Delhi to do ‘whatever is necessary’ to bolster relations, officials said after Minister S. Jaishankar talks with his Afghan counterpart; Centre considering aid for Afghans expelled by Pakistan.

title: SC rules ISKCON-Bangalore owner of Hare Krishna hill temple
content: The apex court found the High Court’s conclusion that ISKCON-Mumbai owned the temple through its branch in Bangalore “completely erroneous” and “contrary to the documentary evidence”

title: Use drones to keep vigil on vulnerable places, Krishna SP tells personnel
content: Gangadhar Rao directs Station House Officers to address complaints received through Public Grievance Redressal System on a priority basis

title:
Amit Shah inaugurates revamped multi-agency network built
at ₹500 cr. to fight terrorism
content: As many as 28 organisations, including the Research and Analysis Wing (RAW), armed forces and State police, are part of the platform and various security agencies share real time intelligence inputs on MAC

title: U.K. determined to play role in improving India-Pakistan ties, fighting terror: Lammy
content: The U.K. Foreign Secretary strongly condemns terrorism and reminds of close ties that India and Pakistan enjoy with his country

title: Heavy rain, thunderstorm likely at some places in A.P. in next four days
content: Masada in Hukumpeta mandal of Alluri Sitharama Raju district and Ankampalle in Beluguppa mandal of Anantapur district recorded the highest rainfall of 18.5 mm on Friday

title: Nagpur woman goes missing in village along LoC in Kargil
content: Though her whereabouts were not known yet, police officials said that the woman had tried to cross over to Pakistan near Amritsar border in Punjab in March this year.

title: Murshidabad violence victims anxious about safety, State must ensure protection: Calcutta HC
content: The court notes that the committee report points to vandalism and massacre as ‘premeditated and an organised crime’; the court added that the victims’ demand for a permanent camp of Central forces shall be considered

title: BJP, BSP condemn SP leader Ram Gopal Yadav’s comments on Air Force officer Vyomika Singh
content: Mr. Yadav had sparked a controversy when he said Col. Sofiya Qureshi was being targeted by a BJP Minister as she is a Muslim, but Wg Cdr. Singh was spared thinking she was Rajput.

title: Opposition agrees to join govt.’s diplomatic outreach on India-Pakistan conflict
content: Centre to send eight delegations to Europe, West Asia and Africa and explain India’s stand on the conflict with Pakistan; Rijiju dials senior leaders from Congress, CPI(M), DMK, AIMIM and other parties

title: WB govt. Staff hail court order directing State to pay 25% DA arrears
content: The decision will benefit 12 lakh employees and pensioners and is likely to cost ₹10,000 crore. Leader of the Opposition Suvendu Adhikari demanded Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee’s resignation over the matter

title: Handloom and Textiles tie up with SPA to modernise Lepakshi showrooms across AP
content: New showrooms will reflect the Andhra Pradesh’s rich history, handicrafts, handlooms and the essence of Telugu culture; the designs will be developed in collaboration with SPA (Vijayawada)

title: NIA conducts searches at 15 locations linked to Babbar Khalsa International in Punjab
content: The searches were carried out in Gurdaspur, Batala, Amritsar, and Kapurthala districts leading to the seizure of various incriminating materials, including mobiles/digital devices and documents

title: People of J&K want peace, not war: Mirwaiz Umar Farooq
content: Delivering a customary sermon at the Jama masjid in Srinagar, the Mirwaiz highlighted the deaths of twins in Poonch in the recent military confrontation between India and Pakistan in J&K

title: Supreme Court’s three-month timeline in Tamil Nadu Governor verdict was adopted from Centre’s own guidelines
content: The Supreme Court’s April 8 judgment made it clear that it was merely adopting guidelines issued by the Ministry of Home Affairs

title: Non-functioning of Lok Adalats in 16 districts alarms Rajasthan High Court
content: Court takes suo motu cognisance of delay in tenure extension of presiding officers; flags serious threat to access to justice

title: Opposition mounts pressure on AAP after spurious liquor deaths
content: MLA Kunwar Vijay Pratap Singh criticises own government even as CM Bhagwant Mann urged to take full responsibility; calls for probe and accountability intensify

title: Telangana urges KWDT-II to rectify anomaly of assured irrigation compared to A.P. in Krishna Basin
content: Counsel for Telangana brings to Tribunal’s notice how erstwhile A.P. had placed projects serving outside basin areas in priority and neglected projects serving in-basin areas in TG

title: AG asked to speed up distribution of compensation to employees of Elstone Estate
content: The government is planning to build on the estate a township to accommodate the survivors of the Mundakkai-Chooralmala landslides

title: Supreme Court strikes down retrospective environmental clearances
content: The concept of an ex post facto EC is in derogation of the fundamental principles of environmental jurisprudence and is an anathema to the EIA Notification of January 27, 1994, says Bench

title: TNSTC bus conductor’s daughter scores 499 out of 500 in Class 10
content: She scored centum in four subjects and missed out centum in Tamil; TNSTC Kumbakonam MD felicitates her; she aspires to be a doctor

title: Teachers in West Bengal resume protests; police justify use of force as ‘minimal’
content: The use of force brought heavy criticism from Opposition political parties. Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari and other BJP leaders Sajal Ghosh and Kaustav Bagchi met the teachers on May 16

title: 27 families to get initial ₹10 lakh each today for relocation from Gawali village
content: Forest minister to visit Bhimgad Wildlife Sanctuary today as State govt. is facilitating voluntary relocation of residents from wildlife sanctuaries

title: Bihar Congress accuses State government of trying to thwart Rahul Gandhi’s event in Darbhanga
content: Despite the denial of permission, Rahul had addressed the gathering at the Darbhanga hostel, holding up a photograph of Dr. Ambedkar. Later, two FIRs were lodged against Mr. Gandhi and over 100 party workers

title: NH-66 widening project to be completed in December this year: P.A. Mohamed Riyas
content: Minister for General Education inaugurates over 50 PWD roads constructed in different districts and 12 smart roads in Thiruvananthapuram

title: CPI(M) rallies behind Vedan and Colonel Sofia Qureshi, portrays them as targets of RSS’s “casteism and communal hate”
content: Sangh Parivar’s reproachable denigration of Vedan and his crowd-pulling performances embodied RSS’s spite for persons from marginalised sections of society. RSS’s anti-Muslim spite manifested in a BJP Minister’s communal vitriol against Colonel Sofia Qureshi

title: How Boston avoids breaking up its roster, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Knicks pound Celtics by 38 to reach East finals
content: The Knicks reached the Eastern Conference finals for the first time in 25 years and ended the one-year NBA title reign of the Celtics with astonishing ease, rolling to a 119-81 victory in Game 6 on Friday night.

title: Sources: Purdy, 49ers reach 5-year, $265M deal
content: Brock Purdy, the last pick in the 2022 NFL draft who has gone on to become a Pro Bowler, is finalizing a 5-year, $265M deal with the 49ers, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter.

title: Mets' Soto listens to boos, tips hat in Bronx return
content: Juan Soto's return to Yankee Stadium in a Mets uniform Friday night went just about as he expected: with loud, relentless boos and chants from a scorned fanbase still offended by his offseason choice.

title: Report: Rory driver ruled nonconforming at PGA
content: Rory McIlroy was forced to use a backup driver in the PGA Championship when his regular driver was tested and deemed to be nonconforming after he arrived at Quail Hollow, according to a report on SiriusXM PGA Tour Radio on Friday.

title: Collier pours in 34 as Lynx spoil Bueckers' debut
content: Napheesa Collier scored 34 points to outshine the WNBA debut of Paige Bueckers, who had 10 points, in the Minnesota Lynx's 99-84 win over the Dallas Wings on Friday night.

title: Matthews helps Leafs top Panthers, force Game 7
content: Auston Matthews got his first goal of the series to break a scoreless tie in the third period and the Toronto Maple Leafs kept their season alive by beating the Florida Panthers 2-0 in Game 6 of their Eastern Conference semifinal series Friday night.

title: Sources: Nuggets' Gordon in doubt for Game 7
content: Nuggets forward Aaron Gordon is in doubt for Sunday's Game 7 after being diagnosed with a strained left hamstring, sources told ESPN.

title: Fever's Clark on entering Year 2: 'I know I belong'
content: As she embarks on her second season in the WNBA, Fever star Caitlin Clark likened her rookie year to being a freshman in high school and then college, saying that going into Year 2, "You just have a different sense of confidence about you."

title: 📈 Bueckers' hometown temporarily renames itself
content: Hopkins, Minnesota, will have a ribbon-cutting ceremony, food and beverages named after Bueckers, and a watch party for the WNBA rookie's debut.

title: Paige Bueckers leads WNBA's best dressed on opening night
content: Before the WNBA's best take the floor, they dazzled the pregame tunnel with their opening-night outfits.

title: Will Aaron Judge hit .400? Blast 60 home runs? Our predictions based on his incredible start
content: The Yankees' superstar outfielder is outdoing even himself so far. Will he go over or under his current pace?

title: 49ers QB Brock Purdy is no longer Mr. Irrelevant: New contract comes with pressure to lead, win
content: San Francisco has long benefited from the league's best bargain contract. Now, it's on Purdy to deliver results.

title: Derek Carr retired, then an avalanche of unanswered questions followed
content: Derek Carr surprisingly announced his retirement on May 10. The decision -- and the timing -- has insiders throughout the league talking.

title: Who are the best coaches in college football? We rank the top 10
content: Kirby Smart has to be No. 1, or does he? What about Ryan Day? Or Marcus Freeman? Who made our list -- and why.

title: Tiering 25 rookie running backs by expected role: Lead backs, committee options and depth backups
content: Which rookie RBs will make noise in 2025? We grouped 25 draft picks by expected Year 1 role, from Ashton Jeanty to Jacory Croskey-Merritt.

title: Chelsea's struggles without Jackson make Champions League qualification uncertain
content: Chelsea barely beat Man United, but serious questions linger about whether the Blues can clinch a Champions League spot as Nicolas Jackson remains out.

title: Every Premier League team reranked: Spurs, Forest plummet; Man United can't bounce back
content: It's time to rank all 20 teams in the Premier League one final time! Did Man United or Man City bounce back? Could Forest and Tottenham hang on?

title: Maresca: Stop judging Chelsea by past glories
content: Enzo Maresca has warned onlookers not to judge Chelsea against their past glory days and urged supporters to "trust" him after taking a significant step towards Champions League qualification.

title: Pep slams Prem scheduling: 9 years fighting this
content: Pep Guardiola has hit out at the Premier League over the scheduling of Manchester City's fixture against Bournemouth.

title: Salah: Don't boo TAA in final Liverpool games
content: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah has called for fans not to boo teammate Trent Alexander-Arnold in the club's remaining games this season.

title: Arteta: Havertz transformed body during injury
content: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta says Kai Havertz has undergone a "transformation in his body" while being injured and claimed he "destroyed all the metrics we had in the gym for the last 10 years."

title: Villa ease past Spurs for big boost to UCL hopes
content: High-flying Aston Villa dispatched Tottenham Hotspur 2-0 in the Premier League on Friday to improve their chances of more Champions League football and leave their visitors firmly focused on next week's Europa League final.

title: NWSL: Game should've stopped after King collapse
content: The National Women's Soccer League said that it would abandon future games that have life-threatening emergencies to players.

title: Everton's new home named Hill Dickinson Stadium
content: Everton have confirmed they have struck a deal with law firm Hill Dickinson to become the naming rights partner for the club's new stadium.

title: Galaxy extend coach despite record winless start
content: Head coach Greg Vanney has been given a multi-year contract extension by the defending MLS Cup champion LA Galaxy despite their historic 13-game winless skid to start the new season.

title: Welcome to Banditland: Buffalo eyeing an NLL championship three-peat
content: The Bandits are on the verge of history, while star Dhane Smith is also chasing down an all-time record -- owned by his coach.

title: UFC Fight Night: Does Burns have a best path to ending Morales' unbeaten run?
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Fantasy facts vs. feelings on Clark, Bueckers and more
content: Liz Loza helps fantasy managers separate the facts from the feelings leading up to the start of the 2025 WNBA season.

title: Trump vs Taylor Swift Worsens, Rockstar Springsteen Draws "Overrated" Jibe
content: President Donald Trump used his down time on Air Force One to insult "obnoxious JERK" Bruce Springsteen and declare Taylor Swift "no longer HOT" in social media blasts against the music giants.

title: "India Has Launched Missiles": Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif Recounts 2:30 AM Asim Munir Call
content: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif in a rare public admission confirmed Indian ballistic missiles struck the Nur Khan Airbase and other targets inside Pakistan during the early hours of May 10.

title: Trump Reiterates India Tariff Claim After S Jaishankar's "Premature" Remark
content: On Donald Trump's claim that India has offered a trade deal with "literally zero tariffs", S Jaishankar said that the ongoing negotiations are complex and far from final.

title: Trump Planning To Permanently Relocate 1 Million Palestinians To Libya: Report
content: The plan is under "serious consideration", and the Trump administration has discussed it with Libya's leadership, NBC News reported.

title: In Major Bureaucratic Reshuffle, 42 Delhi Government Officers Transferred
content: The Delhi government, in line with the reshuffle, carried out interdepartmental transfers and postings of 42 senior AGMUT and DANICS cadre officers.

title: Gurugram Techie Admits To Cops Why He Was Living In Hiding In Ayodhya
content: Investigation revealed that the man had formatted his mobile phone a day before going missing, which raised suspicion.

title: Bad News For Trump, US Loses Last AAA Rating, Moody's Flags Rising Debt
content: The United States lost its last triple-A credit rating from a major agency as Moody's announced a downgrade, citing rising levels of government debt and dealing a blow to Donald Trump's narrative of economic strength and prosperity.

title: Musk's xAI Blames 'Unauthorised' Tweak For 'White Genocide' Posts
content: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence startup has blamed an "unauthorised modification" for causing its chatbot Grok to generate misleading and unsolicited posts referencing "white genocide" in South Africa.

title: Rajasthan Government Challenges Acquittal Of Actors Saif Ali Khan, Tabu In Blackbuck Poaching Case
content: The state government's appeal challenges these acquittals and will also include issues related to transfer petition permissions and the sentence awarded to Salman Khan.

title: "Result Of This Decision Will...": Trump As US Top Court Blocks His Deportations
content: Donald Trump's retort came after the US Supreme Court blocked his bid to resume deportations of alleged Venezuelan gang members.

title: Nine Killed In Lightning Strikes In Odisha, Weather Office Issues Alert
content: While three persons died in Koraput district, two each died in Jajpur and Ganjam districts, and one each in Dhenkanal and Gajapati districts.

title: Man Who Stabbed Author Salman Rushdie Sentenced To 25 Years In Prison
content: The man convicted of stabbing Salman Rushdie on a New York lecture stage in 2022, leaving the prizewinning author blind in one eye, was sentenced Friday to serve 25 years in prison.

title: Case Filed Against Man For Touching Tiger Cubs At Rajasthan's Ranthambore
content: A First Information Report (FIR) has been filed after a video surfaced showing a man dangerously close to tiger cubs at the Ranthambore National Park near Sawai Madhopur in Rajasthan, officials confirmed.

title: "Let's Not Waste Time" With US-Backed Gaza Aid Plan: UN Aid Chief
content: United Nations aid chief Tom Fletcher said on Friday that time should not be wasted on an alternative U.S.-backed proposal to deliver aid to Gaza, saying the U.N. has a proven plan and 160,000 pallets of relief ready to enter the Palestinian enclave

title: Israel Expands Operations In Gaza To Dismantle Hamas, Free Hostages
content: The Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) intensified their military operations in Gaza, launching strikes and mobilising additional troops.

title: "A Lot Of people Starving In Gaza": Trump Stresses Help For Palestinians
content: Amid the ongoing Israel-Hamas conflict, US President Donald Trump stressed the importance of addressing the humanitarian situation in Gaza, where many are facing severe food shortages and said that a lot of people are starving in the region.

title: Northern Army Commander Reviews Security Situation In Jammu And Kashmir
content: Northern Army Commander Lieutenant General Pratik Sharma visited the Poonch and Naushera districts of Jammu and Kashmir and reviewed the prevailing security situation and operational readiness, the Army said.

title: US Supreme Court Blocks Trump Bid To Resume Venezuelan Deportations
content: The US Supreme Court on Friday blocked a bid by the Trump administration to resume deportations of alleged Venezuelan gang members using an obscure wartime law to avoid normal due process.

title: US Planning To Permanently Relocate 1 Million Palestinians To Libya: Report
content: The Trump administration is working on a plan to permanently relocate as much as one million Palestinians from the Gaza Strip to Libya, NBC News reported on Friday, citing five people with knowledge of the matter.

title: 4-Year-Old Boy Dies Under Suspicious Circumstances In UP School: Cops
content: A four-year-old boy allegedly died under suspicious circumstances at a school here on Friday, with police suspecting that he was beaten by two teachers of the institution.

title: FA Cup win won't save Man City, but it can kick-start their rebuild
content: Manchester City have had their fair share of struggles this season, but a win over Crystal Palace in the FA Cup final could spark their return to the top of English and European soccer.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool and Chelsea to challenge Inter for David
